pr_title: Implement the parquet value reader & writer for apache flink

timeline.message: Implement the parquet value reader & writer for apache flink

timeline.author: rdblue

+          ))),
+      optional(2, "slide", Types.StringType.get())
+  );
+
+  @Test
+  public void testCorrectness() throws IOException {
+    int numRows = 2500;

replies.bodyText: OK, let me think about how to add those unit tests. Thanks.
replies.author: openinx

timeline.bodyText: Should this inherit from the one for Iceberg generics to avoid duplicating the list and map methods? Primitive and struct will need to be implemented, but this could reuse a lot there as well.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText:
Instead of adding this interface, what about adding WriteBuilder.createStructWriter to do this? That way, the Flink builder could just inherit from the generic builder and override that one method.
I think that would be cleaner because adding this interface requires also adding public methods to pass the factory. I'd rather not add those public methods if we can avoid it by adding a protected method and change the builder to a protected class.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: I guess we will also need to mark the WriteBuilder from private to public because it will be accessed by flink classes from outside package.
replies.author: openinx

replies.bodyText: protected is not enough for the outside flink package, the WriterBuilder is a static class in org.apache.iceberg.data.parquet , it must be public so that other packages could inherit it.
replies.author: openinx

replies.bodyText: You're right. The class should be public, but the method that will be overridden should be protected.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Em, I've implemented two versions. the first version provides a  public  interfaces with protected StructureWriterFactory and StructReaderFactory, the second version use the inherit WriterBuilder  & ReaderBuilder #1125. For me , seems the first version looks much more concise. I plan to change to version#1 (with the  public interface and protected methods ). Thanks.
replies.author: openinx

replies.bodyText: Could you post the branch with the inheritance version? I'd like to see it to compare. I don't like the extra public classes and methods, and I think that inheritance would be a cleaner public API. I'm curious why you think the other approach looks more concise, though.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText:
The inheritance version is here.

I'm curious why you think the other approach looks more concise, though.

Because the inheritance version will need to expose the buildReader and buildWriter logic , for example this. If we change those logic, will also need to change in flink reader/writers. seems the same logic with the GenericParquetReader.
replies.author: openinx

replies.bodyText: Okay, how about inheriting from the outer class, then? That way, the interface and the method that accepts the factory could be protected. Mainly, I don't think these should be public.
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText:
Why change this to use the GenericRecord instance rather than the Record interface?
I don't see much value in this change. We will just need to change it back if we want to add implementations of Record that are not generic, like we do with our internal classes that extend Avro's IndexedRecord. Ideally, I'd like to change those over to use our generics readers eventually.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: I changed this because the buildReader method return the GenericRecord ParquetValueReader. Seems better to change the ParquetValueReader to be Record reader.
replies.author: openinx

timeline.bodyText: Similar to the write path, I think it would be nice to refactor this to avoid exposing new public methods and interfaces.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.message: Revert the generic type in GenericParquetReaders#buildReader
Add test suits for DictionaryEncodedData and FallbackData
Revert to user the StructWriterFactory & StructReaderFactory
Use the Record instead of GenericRecord

timeline.bodyText: I tried to mark this method to be protected but seems java8 don't allow to do that....
timeline.author: openinx

timeline.bodyText: How about RandomRecordGenerator instead of RandomRecordDataGenerator? I think that's more descriptive since it returns random records.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: Good to know that this passes, but I don't think we need to run with this high of a record count every time in CI. Could you reduce this to 20_000?
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.message: Make the flink parquet reader/write inherit the generic parquet reader writer.

timeline.bodyText: I changed the buildReader to buildRowReader  because the parent buildReader will return with a ParquetValueReader <Record> data type, which clashes with this FlinkParquetReaders 's buildReader returned ParquetValueReader <Row>.
timeline.author: openinx
